meanings.definition: Having a projecting jaw or jaws.
meanings.sent1: The bulldog had a prognathic jaw that made it look tough.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the prognathic skull of the ancient human remains.
meanings.sent3: The prognathic jaw of the cartoon character made it comically unique.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a prognathic impact on the audience, leaving them stunned.
meanings.sent5: The prognathic jaw of the dinosaur in the movie was incredibly realistic.

meanings.definition: A person or animal with a projecting jaw.
meanings.sent1: The lion, with its prognathic, powerful jaw, roared loudly in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a fossil of a prognathic human ancestor.
meanings.sent3: The prognathic dog in the park attracted a lot of attention from passersby.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a prognathic force driving her towards success.
meanings.sent5: The prognathic of the horse gave it a majestic appearance.

meanings.definition: The condition of having a protruding lower jaw.
meanings.sent1: The orthodontist recommended braces to correct the prognathic condition.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian examined the prognathic of the rabbit to ensure its health.
meanings.sent3: The prognathic of the cartoon character made it stand out in the show.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness was like a prognathic barrier to reaching a compromise.
meanings.sent5: The prognathic of the statue made it look imposing in the square.
